data.title: Evolutionary Theories: Lamarck and Spencer
data.meta_description: Explore the contributions of Jean-Baptiste Lamarck and Herbert Spencer to evolutionary theory. Learn about Lamarck's idea of the Inheritance of acquired characteristics and Spencer's perspective on the survival of the fittest.
data.text:
Questions and Answers What principle did Spencer use to explain how associations are formed? The principle of continuity (correct) The principle of contiguity The principle of temporal proximity The principle of simultaneity What did Spencer call the observation that behaviors conducive to survival are more likely to happen and those that cause pain will be avoided? The Law of Effect The Survival Instinct The Principle of Reinforcement The Spencer-Bain Principle (correct) What did Spencer claim about the inheritance of associations? Associations were acquired through environmental exposure Associations were inherited through genetic transmission Associations were a result of natural selection and survival of the fittest Associations were a blend of empiricism, associationism, and nativism (correct) What did Spencer and Darwin disagree on regarding the concept of evolution?

Spencer believed evolution had a purpose, while Darwin did not

Signup and view all the answers What was Spencer's view on the role of government in the context of Social Darwinism?

He believed in a laissez-faire government to allow the survival of the fittest

Signup and view all the answers What contribution did Spencer make to the history of psychology through his textbook?

His textbook popularized positive science and utilitarian ethics

Signup and view all the answers What did Lamarck believe was responsible for the structural changes in plants and animals?

Environmental changes

Signup and view all the answers What did Lamarck call the idea that acquired characteristics could be inherited?

Inheritance of acquired traits

Signup and view all the answers What did Spencer believe about the human nervous system?

It was simple and has become more complex over time

Signup and view all the answers What did Spencer believe was the key factor that determines an animal's intelligence?

The number of associations it can make

Signup and view all the answers Which philosopher's system of logic inspired Spencer's views on evolution?

John Stuart Mill

Signup and view all the answers What was Spencer's professional background before becoming interested in psychology and evolution?

He worked in the railroad industry
